title: Grandid.com is blocking me from accecing my google accounts by rederecting me to grandid.com.
content:
I'm having a problem and need your help. Every time I try to go to Gmail (gmail.com) or Google Earth (earth.google.com), I get redirected to this site called grandid.com which is the website my school uses to log in to school accounts. This is my home cumputer so i am not intrestend in that and would like to completly block grandid.com from ever redirecting me. It's blocking me from logging into my accounts and using these services.

I've cleared my cache and cookies and even tried blocking grandid.com with extensions, but nothing is working. This is really frustrating and messing up my ability to check my emails and use Google Earth.

Can you please help me fix this?

creator: version365

title: Firefox 125.0 (64-bit) Linux - File download location
content:
Hi all,

I'm using Firefox 125.0 (64-bit) on Fedora and for file downloads, I have the options "Ask whether to open or save files" and "Always ask you where to save files" enabled.

This basically works, Firefox opens a file selection dialog and I can select where I want to save my downloads - so far, so good.

The weird thing is, the default location that is shown in this dialog seems to change every time I download a file. I would expect to see the last download location as the default option, but that is not what happens.

When I check about:config, I can see the last used download path is saved as browser.download.lastDir perfectly fine, but it is not set as the default for the next download.

Is there a parameter I can set so this last path is used again?

Thanks,

M.

title: The VA recommends against Firefox
content:
I use the Department of Veteran Affairs for my health care. They set us a system that works well for me to get care appointments, order medications and send messages, and called it MyHealtheVet. It is being merged into larger data bases, I think, and no longer works in a small area for me: Surveys. So I sent a Help Desk inquiry to them and received a reply that says:

Dear Veteran L, Friendly tip: Please ensure that you are using internet browser Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge for quality internet service. The issues with Firefox, Safari, Internet explorer internet browsers does not provide full access of the portal and will continue to provide some type of error message. Thank you for your Service to our Nation. We are in this together. V/R B----- D----- My HealtheVet Assistant Veteran’s Experience Office Bay Pines VA Health Care System PO Box 5005 (OOCR) Bay Pines, FL 33744

I read in Mozilla help instructions that there are changes to my settings that may work for me, but my concern is that the VA folks are going down a path that leaves out Firefox. If I need to start using Edge or Chrome for MyHealtheVet because that is what it is, fine. I'm just surprised.

Já verifiquei com a minha organização e não estão bloqueando esse tipo de acesso e pelo navegador google Chrome eu consigo realizar todos esses procedimentos. Podem me ajudar quanto à isto?

Desde já, eu agradeço!

title: Efficiently Managing Firefox Updates and Patches in a Data Center with Numerous Machines
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm seeking advice on how to efficiently manage Firefox updates and patches in a data center environment where we have a large number of machines. Manually updating each instance of Firefox is not practical due to the scale and the need to ensure minimal downtime.

Here are a few specific questions I have:

1. Automation Tools:

o What tools or software are recommended for automating Firefox updates across multiple machines in a data center?

o Are there any particular scripts or methods that have worked well for you?

2. Best Practices:

o What are the best practices for scheduling updates to ensure minimal disruption to services?

o How do you handle rollback in case an update causes issues?

3. Security:

o How do you ensure that all instances are patched promptly to avoid security vulnerabilities?

o Are there any specific security measures you take during the update process?

4. Monitoring:

o What methods or tools do you use to monitor the update status across all machines?

o How do you verify that all updates have been applied successfully?

5. Challenges and Solutions:

o What challenges have you encountered when managing Firefox updates in a large-scale environment?

o How did you overcome these challenges?

I'd appreciate detailed insights and examples of how you've tackled this issue in your own data centers. Any tips, tricks, or resources would be incredibly helpful.

Thanks in advance for your help!
creator: luciaonmatteo

title: Optimizing Firefox Performance and Troubleshooting Slowdowns
content:
Hi Firefox Community,

I hope everyone is doing well!

I’ve been experiencing some performance issues with Firefox lately, and I’m looking for advice on how to optimize the browser for better speed and responsiveness. I’ve noticed some slowdowns and occasional lag, and I’d appreciate any tips or solutions.

Here are a few specific areas where I need guidance:

Performance Optimization: What are the best settings or adjustments I can make in Firefox to improve overall performance and speed? Extensions and Add-ons: Are there any extensions or add-ons that could be causing slowdowns? How can I identify and manage extensions that impact performance? Troubleshooting Steps: What troubleshooting steps should I follow if Firefox is running slower than usual? Are there any built-in tools or settings that can help diagnose and fix performance issues? Memory and Resource Management: How can I manage Firefox’s memory and resource usage more effectively to ensure smoother operation? Expectations: Configuration Tips: Please include any specific configuration changes or settings adjustments that could enhance Firefox performance. Extension Management: Share advice on how to identify and manage problematic extensions or add-ons. Troubleshooting Techniques: If you have any step-by-step troubleshooting techniques or tools to recommend, that would be helpful. Resource Management: Tips on how to monitor and manage Firefox’s resource usage effectively would be appreciated. Any help or insights would be greatly appreciated. Click here for further information Thank you in advance for your support!

Best regards, Tylor
